title: Warwick Rework
body: I heard there was plan to rework Warwick ... is the plan still going to happen?

replies.body:
The good folks at Reign of Gaming wrote a nice piece detailing the **HIGHLY TENTATIVE** rework in progress. You can check it out [here](http://www.reignofgaming.net/news/27965-updated-warwicks-rework-full-kit-preview).  
Just keep in mind that it's not the official rework that will come out, nor is there a date for the release. The rework in the article is one Riot is currently experimenting with. To answer your question, yes Riot is making the rework.

Hi! We have a strong direction on a Warwick kit--he's totally playable and tracking very well internally. However, the kit changes enough that we cannot ship it without new art: new animations, new particle effects, and new sounds. At this point we would be 90% to remaking the champion, and he really needs it. So the new Warwick kit will ship whenever we have the time to give Warwick a full visual update. I would hope that's some time late this year, but no promises.
You could put the kit on PBE for a few days with borrowed particles just to get some feedback.

You mentioned that with the changes to his kit he can leap in with Hamstring, use Howl to terrify your enemy into your arms.  Will that work for those of us on the East Coast with out 200 ms pings?  Or are you making him into a "skill shot" champion where you need to be on the West Coast to effectively use him?

Yep! I built a system where you can press both buttons at once and the server will cast them for you optimally (i.e. cast W when you're at the peak of your E).

That said, remember that the server gets your packets with roughly the same delay, so all you have to do is memorize relative timing (if I press button 2 roughly half a second after button 1 I get what I want.)

I've got to tell you, Warwick is my *Favorite* champion, I've been playing him since s1 and I don't like part of the proposed direction. I won't rant before I get to test it, but if I do get to test it it'll be too late for my feedback to be heard, if negative. If positive, then I'll be glad with the rework, **but if negative I won't even get to shape the rework of my favorite champion**.

I also want to say next time hold these discussions on the forums and not on Reddit. I find it unacceptable that Riot would share something like this and be gathering feedback off it from a source that doesn't involve their own boards.

Now, what I don't like:  
1. Boomerang dash. Would like it better if I had control over the boomerang effect.  
2. Skillshot ult that can be blocked and roots you.  
3. I play ww as a bruiser, but now I'm incentivized to play him AP tank. Why?  
4. The AoE attack speed was too strong indeed, but the self attack speed didn't have to be scrapped.  
5. CC-lock new WW in a fight and he's lost all his stacks  
6. You communicated his rework. You Didn't GATHER IDEAS about new skills beforehand or ASK PLAYERS WHAT THEY LIKED, (esp. us dedicated players)  
7. If direction is as I believe it is, he has poor itemization options.  

What I like:  
1. Strengths cleared up, weaknessess made more clear.  
2. His W is more interesting.  
3. Less mana dependant.  
4. You can now see jungle creeps. Sweet

> CC-lock new WW in a fight and he's lost all his stacks

Isn't this the point of a tank? That you give the enemy an incentive to focus you, even though it would be better for them to focus the carries? If you're getting CC-locked, your carries are dealing Tons of Damage (TM), unharmed.

Warwicks power as a tank doesn't come from steroids. It comes from the fact that he refills his HP bar while fighting.

In a fight, Malphite has 30% extra armor and 10% extra HP, Nautilus has 300+ 10% extra HP, Mundo has like +80% of his HP, Hecarim heals from the damage he and his allies deal, etc.
Warwick though has to actively fight to stay alive.

And to answer your question, as a tank you want to soak damage, not be perma-cc'd or instagib'd. So, while this does provide the opponents with an incentive to fight WW, it doesn't provide WW incentives to fight.

At least these are my thoughts until I get to try him :)

I think that's kind of intentional - I seems like warwick with the new kit will have two playstyles:

1) Full tank. Probably his only "offensive" item will be wits end; this way even if he gets focused hard, he won't be instagib'd.

2) Full AP - wait for an opening, and 100-0 the enemy squishy.

The "tanky mage ww" won't be effective anymore, because of what you're describing.

Is this bad? I don't think so. It forces WW to make a meaningful decision about his niche (see Morello's recent dev blog).
From what Zenon has mentioned so far, Full Tank/ Tanky mage are the ways you want to go on new WW

This makes it easier to soak damage, because you can do it in multiple places rather than just where you're standing at any given moment. And it's a massive slow so it's good for chasing, and it'll let you steal objectives, and all kinds of other stuff. It's bad at getting from point A to point B faster than you would otherwise, but there's a lot of stuff it does other than that.
thats no longer soaking but dying quickly. There is a difference.

Pulling a guy with an AOE fear and a 2.5 second stun into the middle of your team isn't really a good idea. And besides, the skillshot being Blitz hook is tangential to my point, which is that it's good for stuff other than point A -> point B.
please if u get interrupted the animation is going to be stopped. You are not going to get to continue your previous cmd

That's correct, but Blitz has still pulled WW, who wants to be in the middle of the opposing team so he can use his point-blank AOE fear... into the middle of his team. Not *quite* as bad as pulling Amumu, but still not the sort of hook his team is likely to appreciate.

And the details of Blitzhook are irrelevant to the point I have reiterated several times. To whit, that the skill is not designed for transit from point A to point B, and so has a number of other uses instead.
like telling enemies where to aim skill shots?

The example in discussion was blocking a skillshot that might otherwise kill an ally.

But if you require a list of its other capabilities...

* Allowing quick in-and-out for objective steals
* As a powerful AOE slow, with I believe some damage attached
* Evading skillshots that would otherwise hit no one
* Positioning yourself ahead of fleeing foes to fear them
* Scouting
* Ability's passive grants you vision of low health enemies and considerable move speed when chasing
* Passive grants you vision of low health monsters

What can it not do?

* Get you from Point A to Point B permanently by a means faster than walking

Really, it's a fine ability conceptually. Helps him be in position to tank, lets him use his fear to maximum effect, makes him even better at chasing fleeing foes, and makes him stupidly safe at stealing objectives, coupled with his ability to see how low they get. It's not supposed to be a gap closer.

I actually really liked that aspect of the kit because it worked really well with another change: blood scent detects and reveals big monsters with low health: imagine the counterjungling potential that could present, along with Warwick's innate sustain to help with jungle duels--he could be THE go to counter-jungler. He also can use the new fear ability at the height of his jump, making it impossible to try and smite back. It's obviously not a perfected kit--who knows how it would actually perform in game--but it looks really cool on paper and is an awesome direction for him to go in.
